steps.title: The word â€œStahpâ€ stems from MTVâ€™s hit reality show Jersey Shore.
steps.content: The word â€œStahpâ€ stems from MTVâ€™s hit reality show Jersey Shore . It became a popular slang word in August 2011, poking fun at cast member Sammi â€œSweetheartâ€ Giancolaâ€™s accent. â€œStahp Rahnâ€â€”a phonetic spelling of â€œStop Ronâ€â€”was added to Urban Dictionary as a phrase that means â€œIâ€™M DONE.â€ [4] X Research source In March 2012, Tumblr user @jmiliam posted a â€œsnowcloneâ€ meme of a scornful-looking dog. It was a 4-panel comic with the same image zoomed in closer with each frame, and within 6 months, it went viral on the Internet humor site 9gag. The snowclone meme continued to spread on Tumblr under the hashtag #stahp. Other popular memes included photos of Minecraft, Harry Potter, and Dragon Ball Z.
